data.title: Algebra
data.statement:
Create code that solves an algebraic equation. These will only include plus, minus, and multiplication in the form of {{(co-efficient)(value)}}

Algebra uses letters in mathematics, where each letter represents a number. These letters are called constants. After substituting all letters for their number, the equation becomes ordinary mathematics. However, if there is an equation like <<2x>>, it means 2 * x.

testCases.title: 5 Variables
testCases.testIn:
a + b - c + d + e
5
a = 1
b = 2
c = 3
d = 4
e = 5

testCases.title: Validator 3
testCases.testIn:
f + g + h + i - j
5
f = 1
g = 2
h = 3
i = 4
j = 5

data.stubGenerator:
read equation:string(20)
read constants:int
loop constants read value:string(6)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> A line of text [[equation]], which is the equation that needs to be solved
<<Line 2:>> A number [[constants]], which shows the amount of  there are.
<<Next [[constants]] lines:>> Lines of texts labeled [[value]], which are phrased in the format {{constant = value}}.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Create code that solves an algebraic equation. These will only include plus, minus, and multiplication in the form of (co-efficient)(value)

Algebra uses letters in mathematics, where each letter represents a number. These letters are called constants. After substituting all letters for their number, the equation becomes ordinary mathematics. However, if there is an equation like 2x, it means 2 * x.
Input
Line 1: A line of text equation, which is the equation that needs to be solved
Line 2: A number constants, which shows the amount of there are.
Next constants lines: Lines of texts labeled value, which are phrased in the format constant = value.
Output
The answer of equation.
Constraints
0 < constants < 6
Example
Input
a + 1
1
a = 1
Output
2
